sourceDesc.p: Generated from the TLS textfiles as exported on 2020-02-21. First source reported:SHANGBO.ZHAOWANGHUISHI 4.17.1 (STRIP 1) JI XUSHENG 4: 50
Translation of 楚竹書・昭王毁室(en) into English.

p.seg: King Zhao made a building in the vicinity of an area of still waters
Once the building was completed,
he was going to inaugurate it (with a feast including the dripping of sacrificial blood)
The king invited the dignitaries of the state to drink wine,
and when that was finished, he was going to inaugurate it
As the king entered and was going to perform the inauguration,
there was a gentleman in mourning dress who transgressed into the court
and was going to go to the inner gate
The attendant stopped him saying:
the king has just entered into the palace,
you cannot enter dressed like this
He did not stop and said:
my burial arrangements will be decided today
if you must stop me,
I will start (=now) to break in.
The attendant did not dare to stop him.
When he reached the inner gate,
the XXX official was on duty,
he announced:
I should not disgrace the king with this,
[but] unfortunately my father’s bones are under the stairs of this building
I will collect (the remains) of my deceased father
[...] if I will not obtain (the permission) to rejoin the bones of my deceased parents,
I will provide on my own (=I will do it anyway)
